title: Real Orange Beef
ingredients: 1 pound beef filet mignon tails or flank steak
2 pieces dried tangerine peel (about 2-inches long) soaked in warm water and slivered, then reserve ¼ cup of the soaking water
4 slices peeled fresh ginger (each about the size of a quarter), slivered
instructions: Slice the meat into thin strips about 2-inches long and ¼-inch thick.  In a small bowl combine the dark soy sauce, cornstarch, and pepper.  Add the beef, toss it to coat the beef well, and let it stand for 10 minutes.

In a carbon-steel wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat until just smoking.  Deep fry the beef slices, in batches, for about 5 minutes, until it’s crisp.  Remove the batches to paper towels to drain.  Pour off the oil from the wok and either reserve it for another use or discard it.  Do not clean the wok.

Set the wok over high heat and add the tangerine peel, ginger, and orange zest.  Stir-fry for about 30 seconds, until aromatic.  Add the sherry, orange juice, thin soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and reserved tangerine water.  Bring to a simmer and cook for about 2 minutes, until slightly reduced.
Add the beef to the sauce and toss it to mix and coat it well with the sauce.  Drizzle with the sesame oil and serve immediately over rice.
Source:  New Wok Cooking by Rosa Ross, Clarkson Potter/Publishers, New York, © 2000 by Rosa Ross.
